rules.ruleString: Unit was previously coded {CPE1001, CSE1202, GCO1811, MMS1801, MMS1802}

(Incompatible with course version in {1794, 2146, 3301, 3803} with course status in {ENROLLED, INACTIVE, INTERMIT} and  Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {CPE1001, CSE1202, FIT1051, GCO1811, MMS1801, MMS1802})

description: This unit will provide students with an overview of programming and its role in problem-solving and strategies for meeting user requirements and for designing solutions to programming problems. The fundamental programming concepts of the memory model, data types, declarations, expressions and statements, control structures, block structure, modules, parameters and input and output will be applied within the context of objects, attributes, methods, re-use, information-hiding, encapsulation and message-passing. Software engineering topics include maintainability, readability, testing, documentation and modularisation.
